messageSources.description: Represents a listener for HTTP requests.

parameters.description: Relative path from the path set in the HTTP Listener configuration
parameters.name: path

displayModel.summary: Comma separated list of methods. Leave empty to allow all.

parameters.description: Comma separated list of allowed HTTP methods by this listener. To allow all methods do not defined the attribute.
parameters.name: allowedMethods

parameters.description: Defines if the response should be sent using streaming or not. If this attribute is not present, the behavior will depend on the type of the payload (it will stream only for InputStream). If set to true, it will always stream. If set to false, it will never stream. As streaming is done the response will be sent user Transfer-Encoding: chunked.
parameters.name: responseStreamingMode

parameters.description: The mime type of the payload that this operation outputs.
parameters.name: outputMimeType

parameters.description: The encoding of the payload that this operation outputs.
parameters.name: outputEncoding

parameters.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component
parameters.name: config-ref

parameters.description: Whether this source should only be executed on the primary node when runnning in Cluster
parameters.name: primaryNodeOnly

parameters.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

description.value: This is the amount of memory that will be allocated in order to consume the stream and provide random access to it. If the stream contains more data than can be fit into this buffer, then it will be expanded by according to the bufferSizeIncrement attribute, with an upper limit of maxInMemorySize.

This is by how much will be buffer size by expanded if it exceeds its initial size. Setting a value of zero or lower will mean that the buffer should not expand, meaning that a STREAM_MAXIMUM_SIZE_EXCEEDED error will be raised when the buffer gets full.
This is the maximum amount of memory that will be used. If more than that is used then a STREAM_MAXIMUM_SIZE_EXCEEDED error will be raised. A value lower or equal to zero means no limit.
The unit in which all these attributes are expressed
Defines the maximum memory that the stream should use to keep data in memory. If more than that is consumed then it will start to buffer the content on disk.
The unit in which maxInMemorySize is expressed

This configuration allows the input stream to be read only once. It will not allow to seek randomly which will limit the transformations that DW can perform on this stream. Use this option for use cases which just require moving data around from one system to another to get optimum performance.

parameters.name: streamingStrategy

parameters.description: Defines a policy for processing the redelivery of the same message

description.value: The maximum number of times a message can be redelivered and processed unsuccessfully before triggering process-failed-message
The secure hashing algorithm to use. If not set, the default is SHA-256.
Defines which strategy is used to identify the messages.
Whether to use a secure hash algorithm to identify a redelivered message
Defines one or more expressions to use to determine when a message has been redelivered. This property may only be set if useSecureHash is false.
The object store where the redelivery counter for each message is going to be stored.

parameters.name: redeliveryPolicy

parameters.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

description.value: How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread
How many reconnection attempts to make
How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread

parameters.name: reconnectionStrategy

connectionProviders.name: listener
connectionProviders.description: Connection provider for a HttpListener, handles the creation of HttpServer instances.

parameters.description: Reference to a TLS config element. This will enable HTTPS for this config.

description.value: A comma separated list of protocols enabled for this context.
A comma separated list of cipher suites enabled for this context.
Trust store configuration. If used client side, the trust store contains the certificates of the trusted servers. If used server side, it contains the certificates of the trusted clients.
The location (which will be resolved relative to the current classpath and file system, if possible) of the trust store.
The password used to protect the trust store.
The type of store used.

displayModel.example: jks, jceks, pkcs12 or other store type

description.value: The algorithm used by the trust store.
If true, no certificate validations will be performed, rendering connections vulnerable to attacks. Use at your own risk.
Key store configuration. The key store contains the keys of this server/client.
The location (which will be resolved relative to the current classpath and file system, if possible) of the key store.
The type of store used.

displayModel.example: jks, jceks, pkcs12 or other store type

description.value: When the key store contains many private keys, this attribute indicates the alias of the key that should be used. If not defined, the first key in the file will be used by default.
The password used to protect the private key.
The password used to protect the key store.
The algorithm used by the key store.

Uses the standard JVM certificate revocation checks, which depend on the certificate having the corresponding extension points (additional tags for CRLDP or OCSP), and the availability of revocation servers.
Only verify the last element of the certificate chain.
Try CRL instead of OCSP first.
Do not use the secondary checking method (the one not selected before).
Avoid verification failure when the revocation server can not be reached or is busy.

Uses a custom OCSP responder for certificate revocation checks, with a specific trusted certificate for revocating other keys. This ignores extension points (additional tags for CRLDP or OCSP) present in the certificate, if any.
The URL of the OCSP responder.
Alias of the signing certificate for the OCSP response (must be in the trust store), if present.
Local file based certificate revocation checker, which requires a CRL file to be accessible and ignores extension points (additional tags for CRLDP and OCSP) in the certificate.
The path to the CRL file.

parameters.name: tlsContext

parameters.description: Protocol to use for communication. Valid values are HTTP and HTTPS. Default value is HTTP. When using HTTPS the HTTP communication is going to be secured using TLS / SSL. If HTTPS was configured as protocol then the user needs to configure at least the keystore in the tls:context child element of this listener-config.
parameters.name: protocol

parameters.description: Port where the requests will be received.

parameters.description: If false, each connection will be closed after the first request is completed.
parameters.name: usePersistentConnections

parameters.description: The number of milliseconds that a connection can remain idle before it is closed. The value of this attribute is only used when persistent connections are enabled.
parameters.name: connectionIdleTimeout

parameters.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

description.value: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy
The reconnection strategy to use
How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread
How many reconnection attempts to make

If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread

configurations.name: requestConfig
configurations.description: Configuration element for a HTTP requests.

parameters.description: The identifier of this element used to reference it in other components
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

description.value: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.
A scalar time value for the maximum amount of time a dynamic configuration instance should be allowed to be idle before it's considered eligible for expiration
A time unit that qualifies the maxIdleTime attribute

parameters.name: expirationPolicy

parameters.description: Base path to use for all requests that reference this config.
parameters.name: basePath

parameters.description: Specifies whether to follow redirects or not. Default value is true.
parameters.name: followRedirects

parameters.description: Defines if the request should contain a body or not. If AUTO, it will depend on the method (GET, HEAD and OPTIONS will not send a body).
parameters.name: sendBodyMode

displayModel.summary: Defines if the request should be sent using streaming or not. If this attribute is not present, the behavior will depend on the type of the payload (it will stream only for InputStream).

parameters.description: Defines if the request should be sent using streaming or not. If this attribute is not present, the behavior will depend on the type of the payload (it will stream only for InputStream). If set to true, it will always stream. If set to false, it will never stream. As streaming is done the request will be sent user Transfer-Encoding: chunked.
parameters.name: requestStreamingMode

parameters.description: If true, cookies received in HTTP responses will be stored, and sent in subsequent HTTP requests.
parameters.name: enableCookies

parameters.description: Default HTTP headers the message should include.
parameters.name: defaultHeaders

parameters.description: Default Query parameters the request should include.
parameters.name: defaultQueryParams

parameters.description: Whether to specify a correlationId when publishing messages. This applies both for custom correlation ids specifies at the operation level and for default correlation Ids taken from the current event
parameters.name: sendCorrelationId

parameters.description:
By default, header keys are stored internally in lower-case. This is to improve performance of headers handling and is functionally correct as specified in the RFC.

In the case a server expects headers in a specific case, this flag may be set to true so the case of the header keys are preserved.
parameters.name: preserveHeadersCase

parameters.description: Maximum time that the request element will block the execution of the flow waiting for the HTTP response. If this value is not present, the default response timeout from the Mule configuration will be used.
parameters.name: responseTimeout

parameters.description: Configures a default error handling of the response.
parameters.name: responseValidator

Uses the standard JVM certificate revocation checks, which depend on the certificate having the corresponding extension points (additional tags for CRLDP or OCSP), and the availability of revocation servers.
Only verify the last element of the certificate chain.
Try CRL instead of OCSP first.
Do not use the secondary checking method (the one not selected before).

parameters.name: tlsContext

displayModel.summary: Protocol to use for communication. Valid values are HTTP and HTTPS

parameters.description: Protocol to use for communication. Valid values are HTTP and HTTPS. Default value is HTTP. When using HTTPS the HTTP communication is going to be secured using TLS / SSL. If HTTPS was configured as protocol then the user can customize the tls/ssl configuration by defining the tls:context child element of this listener-config. If not tls:context is defined then the default JVM certificates are going to be used to establish communication.
parameters.name: protocol

parameters.description: Host where the requests will be sent.
parameters.name: host

parameters.description: Port where the requests will be sent. If the protocol attribute is HTTP (default) then the default value is 80, if the protocol attribute is HTTPS then the default value is 443.
parameters.name: port

parameters.description: If false, each connection will be closed after the first request is completed.
parameters.name: usePersistentConnections

parameters.description: The maximum number of outbound connections that will be kept open at the same time. By default the number of connections is unlimited.
parameters.name: maxConnections

parameters.description: The number of milliseconds that a connection can remain idle before it is closed. The value of this attribute is only used when persistent connections are enabled.
parameters.name: connectionIdleTimeout

parameters.description: Whether or not received responses should be streamed, meaning processing will continue as soon as all headers are parsed and the body streamed as it arrives. When enabled, the response MUST be eventually read since depending on the configured buffer size it may not fit into memory and processing will stop until space is available.
parameters.name: streamResponse

parameters.description: The space in bytes for the buffer where the HTTP response will be stored.
parameters.name: responseBufferSize

parameters.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

description.value: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy
The reconnection strategy to use
How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread
How many reconnection attempts to make
How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread

parameters.name: reconnection

extensionModel.description:
HTTP connector used to handle and perform HTTP requests.

This class only serves as an extension definition. It's configurations are divided on server () and client () capabilities.

displayModel.summary: Sets the 'SO_TIMEOUT' value when the socket is used as a server
The maximum queue length for incoming connections
Indicates whether the transmitted data should not be collected together for greater efficiency, and sent immediately
This indicates for how long, in milliseconds, the socket will take to close so any remaining data istransmitted correctly
Indicates whether the open socket connections unused for a long period and with an unavailable connection should be closed
Whether the socket should fail during its creation if the host set on the endpoint cannot be resolved
The size of the buffer (in bytes) used when sending data
The size of the buffer (in bytes) used when receiving data
Time, in milliseconds, that the socket will wait in a blocking operation before failing
Indicates whether if the configured socket could be reused or fail at when trying to bind it
Time to wait during a connection to a remote server before failing with a timeout
Indicates whether the transmitted data should not be collected together for greater efficiency, and sent immediately
This indicates for how long, in milliseconds, the socket will take to close so any remaining data istransmitted correctly
Indicates whether the open socket connections unused for a long period and with an unavailable connection should be closed
Whether the socket should fail during its creation if the host set on the endpoint cannot be resolved
The size of the buffer (in bytes) used when sending data
The size of the buffer (in bytes) used when receiving data
Time, in milliseconds, that the socket will wait in a blocking operation before failing
Indicates whether if the configured socket could be reused or fail at when trying to bind it

parameters.description: The encoding of the payload that this operation outputs.
parameters.name: outputEncoding

parameters.description: The resource base from where documents are served up. For example: /Users/maxthemule/resources. Inputs should be validated when using expressions here to avoid overexposing files.
parameters.name: resourceBasePath

parameters.description: The default file to serve when a directory is specified. The default value is 'index.html'. Inputs should be validated when using expressions here to avoid overexposing files.
parameters.name: defaultFile

parameters.description: The HttpRequestAttributes coming from an HTTP listener source to check the required resources.
parameters.name: attributes

parameters.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed
